theories_of_willpower_survey_10.Description: If you have just resisted a strong temptation, you feel strengthened and you can withstand any new temptations.

theories_of_willpower_survey_11.Description: It is particularly difficult to resist a temptation after resisting another temptation right before.

theories_of_willpower_survey_12.Description: Resisting temptations activates your willpower and you become even better able to face new upcoming temptations.

theories_of_willpower_survey_13.Description: Your capacity to resist temptations is not limited. Even after you have resisted a strong temptation you can control yourself right afterwards.

theories_of_willpower_survey_2.Description: Strenuous mental activity exhausts your resources, which you need to refuel afterwards (e.g. through taking breaks, doing nothing, watching television, eating snacks).

theories_of_willpower_survey_3.Description: After a strenuous mental activity, your energy is depleted and you must rest to get it refuelled again.

theories_of_willpower_survey_4.Description: When you have been working on a strenuous mental task, you feel energized and you are able to immediately start with another demanding activity.

theories_of_willpower_survey_5.Description: Your mental stamina fuels itself. Even after strenuous mental exertion, you can continue doing more of it.

theories_of_willpower_survey_6.Description: When you have completed a strenuous mental activity, you cannot start another activity immediately with the same concentration because you have to recover your mental energy again.

theories_of_willpower_survey_7.Description: After a strenuous mental activity, you feel energized for further challenging activities.

theories_of_willpower_survey_8.Description: Resisting temptations makes you feel more vulnerable to the next temptations that come along.

theories_of_willpower_survey_9.Description: When situations accumulate that challenge you with temptations, it gets more and more difficult to resist the temptations.
